num_objects.tooltip: Total number of objects in the print.

num_printing_extruders.label: Number of printing extruders
num_printing_extruders.tooltip: Number of extruders used during the print.

only_one_wall_first_layer.label: Only one wall on first layer
only_one_wall_first_layer.tooltip: Use only one wall on first layer, to give more space to the bottom infill pattern.

only_one_wall_top.label: Only one wall on top surfaces
only_one_wall_top.tooltip: Use only one wall on flat top surfaces, to give more space to the top infill pattern.

ooze_prevention.label: Enable
ooze_prevention.tooltip: This option will drop the temperature of the inactive extruders to prevent oozing.

other_layers_print_sequence_nums.label: The number of other layers print sequence

outer_wall_acceleration.label: Outer wall
outer_wall_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of outer wall. Using a lower value can improve quality.

outer_wall_flow_ratio.label: Outer wall flow ratio
outer_wall_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for outer walls.

The actual outer wall flow used is calculated by multiplying this value by the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

outer_wall_line_width.label: Outer wall
outer_wall_line_width.tooltip: Line width of outer wall. If expressed as a %, it will be computed over the nozzle diameter.

outer_wall_speed.label: Outer wall
outer_wall_speed.tooltip: Speed of outer wall which is outermost and visible. It's used to be slower than inner wall speed to get better quality.

output.label: Output File
output.tooltip: The file where the output will be written (if not specified, it will be based on the input file).

outputdir.label: Output directory
outputdir.tooltip: Output directory for the exported files.

overhang_fan_speed.label: Overhangs and external bridges fan speed
overhang_fan_speed.tooltip:
Use this part cooling fan speed when printing bridges or overhang walls with an overhang threshold that exceeds the value set in the 'Overhangs cooling threshold' parameter above. Increasing the cooling specifically for overhangs and bridges can improve the overall print quality of these features.

Please note, this fan speed is clamped on the lower end by the minimum fan speed threshold set above. It is also adjusted upwards up to the maximum fan speed threshold when the minimum layer time threshold is not met.

overhang_fan_threshold.label: Overhang cooling activation threshold
overhang_fan_threshold.tooltip: When the overhang exceeds this specified threshold, force the cooling fan to run at the 'Overhang Fan Speed' set below. This threshold is expressed as a percentage, indicating the portion of each line's width that is unsupported by the layer beneath it. Setting this value to 0% forces the cooling fan to run for all outer walls, regardless of the overhang degree.

overhang_flow_ratio.label: Overhang flow ratio
overhang_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for overhangs.

The actual overhang flow used is calculated by multiplying this value by the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

overhang_reverse.label: Reverse on even
overhang_reverse.tooltip:
Extrude perimeters that have a part over an overhang in the reverse direction on even layers. This alternating pattern can drastically improve steep overhangs.

This setting can also help reduce part warping due to the reduction of stresses in the part walls.

overhang_reverse_internal_only.label: Reverse only internal perimeters
overhang_reverse_internal_only.tooltip:
Apply the reverse perimeters logic only on internal perimeters.

This setting greatly reduces part stresses as they are now distributed in alternating directions. This should reduce part warping while also maintaining external wall quality. This feature can be very useful for warp prone material, like ABS/ASA, and also for elastic filaments, like TPU and Silk PLA. It can also help reduce warping on floating regions over supports.

For this setting to be the most effective, it is recommended to set the Reverse Threshold to 0 so that all internal walls print in alternating directions on even layers irrespective of their overhang degree.

overhang_reverse_threshold.label: Reverse threshold
overhang_reverse_threshold.tooltip:
Number of mm the overhang need to be for the reversal to be considered useful. Can be a % of the perimeter width.
Value 0 enables reversal on every even layers regardless.
When Detect overhang wall is not enabled, this option is ignored and reversal happens on every even layers regardless.

parking_pos_retraction.label: Filament parking position
parking_pos_retraction.tooltip: Distance of the extruder tip from the position where the filament is parked when unloaded. This should match the value in printer firmware.

pellet_flow_coefficient.label: Pellet flow coefficient
pellet_flow_coefficient.tooltip:
Pellet flow coefficient is empirically derived and allows for volume calculation for pellet printers.

Internally it is converted to filament_diameter. All other volume calculations remain the same.

filament_diameter = sqrt( (4 * pellet_flow_coefficient) / PI )

pellet_modded_printer.label: Pellet Modded Printer
pellet_modded_printer.tooltip: Enable this option if your printer uses pellets instead of filaments.

physical_printer_preset.label: Physical printer name
physical_printer_preset.tooltip: Name of the physical printer used for slicing.

position.label: Position
position.tooltip: Position of the extruder at the beginning of the custom G-code block. If the custom G-code travels somewhere else, it should write to this variable so OrcaSlicer knows where it travels from when it gets control back.

post_process.label: Post-processing Scripts
post_process.tooltip: If you want to process the output G-code through custom scripts, just list their absolute paths here. Separate multiple scripts with a semicolon. Scripts will be passed the absolute path to the G-code file as the first argument, and they can access the Orca Slicer config settings by reading environment variables.

precise_outer_wall.label: Precise wall
precise_outer_wall.tooltip: Improve shell precision by adjusting outer wall spacing. This also improves layer consistency. NOTE: This option will be ignored for outer-inner or inner-outer-inner wall sequences.

precise_z_height.label: Precise Z height
precise_z_height.tooltip: Enable this to get precise Z height of object after slicing. It will get the precise object height by fine-tuning the layer heights of the last few layers. Note that this is an experimental parameter.

preferred_orientation.label: Preferred orientation
preferred_orientation.tooltip: Automatically orient STL files on the Z axis upon initial import.

preheat_steps.label: Preheat steps
preheat_steps.tooltip: Insert multiple preheat commands (e.g. M104.1). Only useful for Prusa XL. For other printers, please set it to 1.

preheat_time.label: Preheat time
preheat_time.tooltip: To reduce the waiting time after tool change, Orca can preheat the next tool while the current tool is still in use. This setting specifies the time in seconds to preheat the next tool. Orca will insert a M104 command to preheat the tool in advance.

preset_names.label: Printer preset names
preset_names.tooltip: Names of presets related to the physical printer.

pressure_advance.label: Pressure advance
pressure_advance.tooltip: Pressure advance (Klipper) AKA Linear advance factor (Marlin).

prime_tower_brim_width.label: Brim width
prime_tower_brim_width.tooltip: Brim width of prime tower, negative number means auto calculated width based on the height of prime tower.

prime_tower_enable_framework.label: Internal ribs
prime_tower_enable_framework.tooltip: Enable internal ribs to increase the stability of the prime tower.

prime_tower_skip_points.label: Skip points
prime_tower_skip_points.tooltip: The wall of prime tower will skip the start points of wipe path.

prime_volume.label: Prime volume
prime_volume.tooltip: The volume of material to prime extruder on tower.

print_bed_max.label: Top-right corner of print bed bounding box

print_bed_min.label: Bottom-left corner of print bed bounding box

print_bed_size.label: Size of the print bed bounding box

print_flow_ratio.label: Flow ratio
print_flow_ratio.tooltip:
The material may have volumetric change after switching between molten and crystalline states. This setting changes all extrusion flow of this filament in G-code proportionally. The recommended value range is between 0.95 and 1.05. You may be able to tune this value to get a nice flat surface if there is slight overflow or underflow.

The final object flow ratio is this value multiplied by the filament flow ratio.

print_host.label: Hostname, IP or URL
print_host.tooltip: Orca Slicer can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the hostname, IP address or URL of the printer host instance. Print host behind HAProxy with basic auth enabled can be accessed by putting the user name and password into the URL in the following format: https://username:password@your-octopi-address/

print_host_webui.label: Device UI
print_host_webui.tooltip: Specify the URL of your device user interface if it's not same as print_host.

print_order.label: Intra-layer order
print_order.tooltip: Print order within a single layer.

print_preset.label: Print preset name
print_preset.tooltip: Name of the print preset used for slicing.

print_sequence.label: Print sequence
print_sequence.tooltip: Print sequence, layer by layer or object by object.

print_time.label: Print time (normal mode)
print_time.tooltip: Estimated print time when printed in normal mode (i.e. not in silent mode). Same as normal_print_time.

print_time_sec.label: Print time (seconds)
print_time_sec.tooltip: Total estimated print time in seconds. Replaced with actual value during post-processing.

printable_height.label: Printable height
printable_height.tooltip: Maximum printable height which is limited by mechanism of printer.

printer_agent.label: Printer Agent
printer_agent.tooltip: Select the network agent implementation for printer communication.

printer_notes.label: Printer notes
printer_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the printer here.

printer_preset.label: Printer preset name
printer_preset.tooltip: Name of the printer preset used for slicing.

printer_structure.label: Printer structure
printer_structure.tooltip: The physical arrangement and components of a printing device.

printer_variant.label: Printer variant
printer_variant.tooltip: Name of the printer variant. For example, the printer variants may be differentiated by a nozzle diameter.

printhost_apikey.label: API Key / Password
printhost_apikey.tooltip: Orca Slicer can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the API Key or the password required for authentication.

printhost_cafile.label: HTTPS CA File
printhost_cafile.tooltip: Custom CA certificate file can be specified for HTTPS OctoPrint connections, in crt/pem format. If left blank, the default OS CA certificate repository is used.

printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.label: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks
printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.tooltip: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks in case of missing or offline distribution points. One may want to enable this option for self signed certificates if connection fails.

printing_by_object_gcode.label: Between Object G-code
printing_by_object_gcode.tooltip: Insert G-code between objects. This parameter will only come into effect when you print your models object by object.

printing_filament_types.label: Used filament types
printing_filament_types.tooltip: Comma-separated list of all filament types used during the print.

purge_in_prime_tower.label: Purge in prime tower
purge_in_prime_tower.tooltip: Purge remaining filament into prime tower.

raft_contact_distance.label: Raft contact Z distance
raft_contact_distance.tooltip: Z gap between object and raft. Ignored for soluble interface.

raft_expansion.label: Raft expansion
raft_expansion.tooltip: Expand all raft layers in XY plane.

raft_first_layer_density.label: Initial layer density
raft_first_layer_density.tooltip: Density of the first raft or support layer.

raft_first_layer_expansion.label: Initial layer expansion
raft_first_layer_expansion.tooltip: Expand the first raft or support layer to improve bed plate adhesion.

raft_layers.label: Raft layers
raft_layers.tooltip: Object will be raised by this number of support layers. Use this function to avoid warping when printing ABS.

reduce_crossing_wall.label: Avoid crossing walls
reduce_crossing_wall.tooltip: Detour to avoid traveling across walls, which may cause blobs on the surface.

reduce_fan_stop_start_freq.label: Keep fan always on
reduce_fan_stop_start_freq.tooltip: Enabling this setting means that the part cooling fan will never stop completely and will run at least at minimum speed to reduce the frequency of starting and stopping.

reduce_infill_retraction.label: Reduce infill retraction
reduce_infill_retraction.tooltip: Don't retract when the travel is entirely within an infill area. That means the oozing can't been seen. This can reduce times of retraction for complex model and save printing time, but make slicing and G-code generating slower. Note that z-hop is also not performed in areas where retraction is skipped.

repair.label: Repair
repair.tooltip: Repair the model's meshes if it is non-manifold mesh.

repetitions.label: Repetition count
repetitions.tooltip: Repetition count of the whole model.

required_nozzle_HRC.label: Required nozzle HRC
required_nozzle_HRC.tooltip: Minimum HRC of nozzle required to print the filament. Zero means no checking of nozzle's HRC.

resolution.label: Resolution
resolution.tooltip: The G-code path is generated after simplifying the contour of models to avoid too many points and G-code lines. Smaller value means higher resolution and more time to slice.

resonance_avoidance.label: Resonance avoidance
resonance_avoidance.tooltip:
By reducing the speed of the outer wall to avoid the resonance zone of the printer, ringing on the surface of the model are avoided.
Please turn this option off when testing ringing.

retract_before_wipe.label: Retract amount before wipe
retract_before_wipe.tooltip: The length of fast retraction before wipe, relative to retraction length.

retract_length_toolchange.label: Length
retract_length_toolchange.tooltip: When retraction is triggered before changing tool, filament is pulled back by the specified amount (the length is measured on raw filament, before it enters the extruder).

retract_lift_above.label: Only lift Z above
retract_lift_above.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place above the specified absolute Z.

retract_lift_below.label: Only lift Z below
retract_lift_below.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place below the specified absolute Z.

retract_lift_enforce.label: On surfaces
retract_lift_enforce.tooltip: Enforce Z-Hop behavior. This setting is impacted by the above settings (Only lift Z above/below).

retract_restart_extra.label: Extra length on restart
retract_restart_extra.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after the travel move, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament. This setting is rarely needed.

retract_restart_extra_toolchange.label: Extra length on restart
retract_restart_extra_toolchange.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after changing tool, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament.

retract_when_changing_layer.label: Retract when change layer
retract_when_changing_layer.tooltip: Force a retraction when changes layer.

retraction_distances_when_cut.label: Retraction distance when cut
retraction_distances_when_cut.tooltip: Experimental feature: Retraction length before cutting off during filament change.

retraction_length.label: Length
retraction_length.tooltip: Some amount of material in extruder is pulled back to avoid ooze during long travel. Set zero to disable retraction.

retraction_minimum_travel.label: Travel distance threshold
retraction_minimum_travel.tooltip: Only trigger retraction when the travel distance is longer than this threshold.

retraction_speed.label: Retraction Speed
retraction_speed.tooltip: Speed for retracting filament from the nozzle.

role_based_wipe_speed.label: Role base wipe speed
role_based_wipe_speed.tooltip: The wipe speed is determined by the speed of the current extrusion role. e.g. if a wipe action is executed immediately following an outer wall extrusion, the speed of the outer wall extrusion will be utilized for the wipe action.

rotate.label: Rotate
rotate.tooltip: Rotation angle around the Z axis in degrees.

rotate_x.label: Rotate around X
rotate_x.tooltip: Rotation angle around the X axis in degrees.

rotate_y.label: Rotate around Y
rotate_y.tooltip: Rotation angle around the Y axis in degrees.

scale.label: Scale per object
scale.tooltip:
Contains a string with the information about what scaling was applied to the individual objects. Indexing of the objects is zero-based (first object has index 0).
Example: 'x:100% y:50% z:100%'.

scale_to_fit.label: Scale to Fit
scale_to_fit.tooltip: Scale to fit the given volume.

scan_first_layer.label: Scan first layer
scan_first_layer.tooltip: Enable this to enable the camera on printer to check the quality of first layer.

scarf_angle_threshold.label: Conditional angle threshold
scarf_angle_threshold.tooltip:
This option sets the threshold angle for applying a conditional scarf joint seam.
If the maximum angle within the perimeter loop exceeds this value (indicating the absence of sharp corners), a scarf joint seam will be used. The default value is 155°.

scarf_joint_flow_ratio.label: Scarf joint flow ratio
scarf_joint_flow_ratio.tooltip: This factor affects the amount of material for scarf joints.

scarf_joint_speed.label: Scarf joint speed
scarf_joint_speed.tooltip: This option sets the printing speed for scarf joints. It is recommended to print scarf joints at a slow speed (less than 100 mm/s). It's also advisable to enable 'Extrusion rate smoothing' if the set speed varies significantly from the speed of the outer or inner walls. If the speed specified here is higher than the speed of the outer or inner walls, the printer will default to the slower of the two speeds. When specified as a percentage (e.g., 80%), the speed is calculated based on the respective outer or inner wall speed. The default value is set to 100%.

scarf_overhang_threshold.label: Conditional overhang threshold
scarf_overhang_threshold.tooltip: This option determines the overhang threshold for the application of scarf joint seams. If the unsupported portion of the perimeter is less than this threshold, scarf joint seams will be applied. The default threshold is set at 40% of the external wall's width. Due to performance considerations, the degree of overhang is estimated.

seam_gap.label: Seam gap
seam_gap.tooltip:
In order to reduce the visibility of the seam in a closed loop extrusion, the loop is interrupted and shortened by a specified amount.
This amount can be specified in millimeters or as a percentage of the current extruder diameter. The default value for this parameter is 10%.

seam_position.label: Seam position
seam_position.tooltip: The start position to print each part of outer wall.

seam_slope_conditional.label: Conditional scarf joint
seam_slope_conditional.tooltip: Apply scarf joints only to smooth perimeters where traditional seams do not conceal the seams at sharp corners effectively.

seam_slope_entire_loop.label: Scarf around entire wall
seam_slope_entire_loop.tooltip: The scarf extends to the entire length of the wall.

seam_slope_inner_walls.label: Scarf joint for inner walls
seam_slope_inner_walls.tooltip: Use scarf joint for inner walls as well.

seam_slope_min_length.label: Scarf length
seam_slope_min_length.tooltip: Length of the scarf. Setting this parameter to zero effectively disables the scarf.

seam_slope_start_height.label: Scarf start height
seam_slope_start_height.tooltip:
Start height of the scarf.
This amount can be specified in millimeters or as a percentage of the current layer height. The default value for this parameter is 0.

seam_slope_steps.label: Scarf steps
seam_slope_steps.tooltip: Minimum number of segments of each scarf.

seam_slope_type.label: Scarf joint seam (beta)
seam_slope_type.tooltip: Use scarf joint to minimize seam visibility and increase seam strength.

set_other_flow_ratios.label: Set other flow ratios
set_other_flow_ratios.tooltip: Change flow ratios for other extrusion path types.

silent_mode.label: Supports silent mode
silent_mode.tooltip: Whether the machine supports silent mode in which machine use lower acceleration to print.

silent_print_time.label: Print time (silent mode)
silent_print_time.tooltip: Estimated print time when printed in silent mode.

single_extruder_multi_material.label: Single Extruder Multi Material
single_extruder_multi_material.tooltip: Use single nozzle to print multi filament.

single_extruder_multi_material_priming.label: Prime all printing extruders
single_extruder_multi_material_priming.tooltip: If enabled, all printing extruders will be primed at the front edge of the print bed at the start of the print.

single_instance.label: Single instance mode
single_instance.tooltip: If enabled, the command line arguments are sent to an existing instance of GUI OrcaSlicer, or an existing OrcaSlicer window is activated. Overrides the "single_instance" configuration value from application preferences.

single_loop_draft_shield.label: Single loop after first layer
single_loop_draft_shield.tooltip: Limits the skirt/draft shield loops to one wall after the first layer. This is useful, on occasion, to conserve filament but may cause the draft shield/skirt to warp / crack.

skeleton_infill_density.label: Skeleton infill density
skeleton_infill_density.tooltip: The remaining part of the model contour after removing a certain depth from the surface is called the skeleton. This parameter is used to adjust the density of this section. When two regions have the same sparse infill settings but different skeleton densities, their skeleton areas will develop overlapping sections. Default is as same as infill density.

skeleton_infill_line_width.label: Skeleton line width
skeleton_infill_line_width.tooltip: Adjust the line width of the selected skeleton paths.

skin_infill_density.label: Skin infill density
skin_infill_density.tooltip: The portion of the model's outer surface within a certain depth range is called the skin. This parameter is used to adjust the density of this section. When two regions have the same sparse infill settings but different skin densities, this area will not be split into two separate regions. Default is as same as infill density.

skin_infill_depth.label: Skin infill depth
skin_infill_depth.tooltip: The parameter sets the depth of skin.

skin_infill_line_width.label: Skin line width
skin_infill_line_width.tooltip: Adjust the line width of the selected skin paths.

skip_modified_gcodes.label: Skip modified G-code in 3MF
skip_modified_gcodes.tooltip: Skip the modified G-code in 3MF from printer or filament presets.

skip_objects.label: Skip Objects
skip_objects.tooltip: Skip some objects in this print.

skirt_distance.label: Skirt distance
skirt_distance.tooltip: The distance from the skirt to the brim or the object.

skirt_height.label: Skirt height
skirt_height.tooltip: How many layers of skirt. Usually only one layer.

skirt_loops.label: Skirt loops
skirt_loops.tooltip: Number of loops for the skirt. Zero means disabling skirt.

skirt_speed.label: Skirt speed
skirt_speed.tooltip: Speed of skirt, in mm/s. Zero means use default layer extrusion speed.

skirt_start_angle.label: Skirt start point
skirt_start_angle.tooltip: Angle from the object center to skirt start point. Zero is the most right position, counter clockwise is positive angle.

skirt_type.label: Skirt type
skirt_type.tooltip: Combined - single skirt for all objects, Per object - individual object skirt.

slice.label: Slice
slice.tooltip: Slice the plates: 0-all plates, i-plate i, others-invalid

slice_closing_radius.label: Slice gap closing radius
slice_closing_radius.tooltip: Cracks smaller than 2x gap closing radius are being filled during the triangle mesh slicing. The gap closing operation may reduce the final print resolution, therefore it is advisable to keep the value reasonably low.

slicing_mode.label: Slicing Mode
slicing_mode.tooltip: Use "Even-odd" for 3DLabPrint airplane models. Use "Close holes" to close all holes in the model.

slow_down_for_layer_cooling.label: Slow printing down for better layer cooling
slow_down_for_layer_cooling.tooltip: Enable this option to slow printing speed down to make the final layer time not shorter than the layer time threshold in "Max fan speed threshold", so that layer can be cooled for longer time. This can improve the cooling quality for needle and small details.

slow_down_layer_time.label: Layer time
slow_down_layer_time.tooltip: The printing speed in exported G-code will be slowed down when the estimated layer time is shorter than this value in order to get better cooling for these layers.

slow_down_layers.label: Number of slow layers
slow_down_layers.tooltip: The first few layers are printed slower than normal. The speed is gradually increased in a linear fashion over the specified number of layers.

slow_down_min_speed.label: Min print speed
slow_down_min_speed.tooltip: The minimum print speed to which the printer slows down to maintain the minimum layer time defined above when the slowdown for better layer cooling is enabled.

slowdown_for_curled_perimeters.label: Slow down for curled perimeters
slowdown_for_curled_perimeters.tooltip:
Enable this option to slow down printing in areas where perimeters may have curled upwards. For example, additional slowdown will be applied when printing overhangs on sharp corners like the front of the Benchy hull, reducing curling which compounds over multiple layers.

It is generally recommended to have this option switched on unless your printer cooling is powerful enough or the print speed slow enough that perimeter curling does not happen. If printing with a high external perimeter speed, this parameter may introduce slight artifacts when slowing down due to the large variance in print speeds. If you notice artifacts, ensure your pressure advance is tuned correctly.

Note: When this option is enabled, overhang perimeters are treated like overhangs, meaning the overhang speed is applied even if the overhanging perimeter is part of a bridge. For example, when the perimeters are 100% overhanging, with no wall supporting them from underneath, the 100% overhang speed will be applied.

small_area_infill_flow_compensation.label: Small area flow compensation (beta)
small_area_infill_flow_compensation.tooltip: Enable flow compensation for small infill areas.

small_area_infill_flow_compensation_mode.label: Flow Compensation Model
small_area_infill_flow_compensation_mode.tooltip: Flow Compensation Model, used to adjust the flow for small infill areas. The model is expressed as a comma separated pair of values for extrusion length and flow correction factor. Each pair is on a separate line, followed by a semicolon, in the following format: "1.234, 5.678;"

small_perimeter_speed.label: Small perimeters
small_perimeter_speed.tooltip: This separate setting will affect the speed of perimeters having radius <= small_perimeter_threshold (usually holes). If expressed as percentage (for example: 80%) it will be calculated on the outer wall speed setting above. Set to zero for auto.

small_perimeter_threshold.label: Small perimeters threshold
small_perimeter_threshold.tooltip: This sets the threshold for small perimeter length. Default threshold is 0mm.

solid_infill_direction.label: Solid infill direction
solid_infill_direction.tooltip: Angle for solid infill pattern, which controls the start or main direction of line.

solid_infill_rotate_template.label: Solid infill rotation template
solid_infill_rotate_template.tooltip: This parameter adds a rotation of solid infill direction to each layer according to the specified template. The template is a comma-separated list of angles in degrees, e.g. '0,90'. The first angle is applied to the first layer, the second angle to the second layer, and so on. If there are more layers than angles, the angles will be repeated. Note that not all solid infill patterns support rotation.

spaghetti_detector.label: Enable spaghetti detector
spaghetti_detector.tooltip: Enable the camera on printer to check spaghetti.

sparse_infill_acceleration.label: Sparse infill
sparse_infill_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of sparse infill. If the value is expressed as a percentage (e.g. 100%), it will be calculated based on the default acceleration.

sparse_infill_density.label: Sparse infill density
sparse_infill_density.tooltip: Density of internal sparse infill, 100% turns all sparse infill into solid infill and internal solid infill pattern will be used.

sparse_infill_filament.label: Infill
sparse_infill_filament.tooltip: Filament to print internal sparse infill.

sparse_infill_flow_ratio.label: Sparse infill flow ratio
sparse_infill_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for sparse infill.

The actual sparse infill flow used is calculated by multiplying this value by the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

sparse_infill_line_width.label: Sparse infill
sparse_infill_line_width.tooltip: Line width of internal sparse infill. If expressed as a %, it will be computed over the nozzle diameter.

sparse_infill_pattern.label: Sparse infill pattern
sparse_infill_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern for internal sparse infill.

sparse_infill_rotate_template.label: Sparse infill rotation template
sparse_infill_rotate_template.tooltip: Rotate the sparse infill direction per layer using a template of angles. Enter comma-separated degrees (e.g., '0,30,60,90'). Angles are applied in order by layer and repeat when the list ends. Advanced syntax is supported: '+5' rotates +5° every layer; '+5#5' rotates +5° every 5 layers. See the Wiki for details. When a template is set, the standard infill direction setting is ignored. Note: some infill patterns (e.g., Gyroid) control rotation themselves; use with care.

spiral_finishing_flow_ratio.label: Spiral finishing flow ratio
spiral_finishing_flow_ratio.tooltip: Sets the finishing flow ratio while ending the spiral. Normally the spiral transition scales the flow ratio from 100% to 0% during the last loop which can in some cases lead to under extrusion at the end of the spiral.

spiral_mode.label: Spiral vase
spiral_mode.tooltip: Spiralize smooths out the Z moves of the outer contour. And turns a solid model into a single walled print with solid bottom layers. The final generated model has no seam.

spiral_mode_max_xy_smoothing.label: Max XY Smoothing
spiral_mode_max_xy_smoothing.tooltip: Maximum distance to move points in XY to try to achieve a smooth spiral. If expressed as a %, it will be computed over nozzle diameter.

spiral_mode_smooth.label: Smooth Spiral
spiral_mode_smooth.tooltip: Smooth Spiral smooths out X and Y moves as well, resulting in no visible seam at all, even in the XY directions on walls that are not vertical.

spiral_starting_flow_ratio.label: Spiral starting flow ratio
spiral_starting_flow_ratio.tooltip: Sets the starting flow ratio while transitioning from the last bottom layer to the spiral. Normally the spiral transition scales the flow ratio from 0% to 100% during the first loop which can in some cases lead to under extrusion at the start of the spiral.

split.label: Split
split.tooltip: Detect unconnected parts in the given model(s) and split them into separate objects.

staggered_inner_seams.label: Staggered inner seams
staggered_inner_seams.tooltip: This option causes the inner seams to be shifted backwards based on their depth, forming a zigzag pattern.

standby_temperature_delta.label: Temperature variation
standby_temperature_delta.tooltip: Temperature difference to be applied when an extruder is not active. The value is not used when 'idle_temperature' in filament settings is set to non-zero value.

start_end_points.label: Start end points
start_end_points.tooltip: The start and end points which is from cutter area to garbage can.

supertack_plate_temp.label: Other layers
supertack_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Cool Plate SuperTack.

supertack_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
supertack_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Cool Plate SuperTack.

support_air_filtration.label: Support air filtration
support_air_filtration.tooltip:
Enable this if printer support air filtration
G-code command: M106 P3 S(0-255)

support_angle.label: Pattern angle
support_angle.tooltip: Use this setting to rotate the support pattern on the horizontal plane.

support_bottom_interface_spacing.label: Bottom interface spacing
support_bottom_interface_spacing.tooltip: Spacing of bottom interface lines. Zero means solid interface.

support_bottom_z_distance.label: Bottom Z distance
support_bottom_z_distance.tooltip: The Z gap between the bottom support interface and object.

support_chamber_temp_control.label: Support control chamber temperature
support_chamber_temp_control.tooltip:
This option is enabled if machine support controlling chamber temperature
G-code command: M141 S(0-255)

support_critical_regions_only.label: Support critical regions only
support_critical_regions_only.tooltip: Only create support for critical regions including sharp tail, cantilever, etc.

support_expansion.label: Normal Support expansion
support_expansion.tooltip: Expand (+) or shrink (-) the horizontal span of normal support.

support_filament.label: Support/raft base
support_filament.tooltip: Filament to print support base and raft. "Default" means no specific filament for support and current filament is used.

support_flow_ratio.label: Support flow ratio
support_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for support.

The actual support flow used is calculated by multiplying this value by the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

support_interface_filament.label: Support/raft interface
support_interface_filament.tooltip: Filament to print support interface. "Default" means no specific filament for support interface and current filament is used.

support_interface_flow_ratio.label: Support interface flow ratio
support_interface_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for the support interface.

The actual support interface flow used is calculated by multiplying this value by the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

support_interface_loop_pattern.label: Interface use loop pattern
support_interface_loop_pattern.tooltip: Cover the top contact layer of the supports with loops. Disabled by default.

support_interface_not_for_body.label: Avoid interface filament for base
support_interface_not_for_body.tooltip: Avoid using support interface filament to print support base if possible.

support_interface_pattern.label: Interface pattern
support_interface_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of support interface. Default pattern for non-soluble support interface is Rectilinear, while default pattern for soluble support interface is Concentric.

support_interface_spacing.label: Top interface spacing
support_interface_spacing.tooltip:
Spacing of interface lines. Zero means solid interface.
Force using solid interface when support ironing is enabled.

support_ironing.label: Ironing Support Interface
support_ironing.tooltip: Ironing is using small flow to print on same height of support interface again to make it more smooth. This setting controls whether support interface being ironed. When enabled, support interface will be extruded as solid too.

support_ironing_flow.label: Support Ironing flow
support_ironing_flow.tooltip: The amount of material to extrude during ironing. Relative to flow of normal support interface layer height. Too high value results in overextrusion on the surface.

support_ironing_pattern.label: Support Ironing Pattern
support_ironing_pattern.tooltip: The pattern that will be used when ironing.

support_ironing_spacing.label: Support Ironing line spacing
support_ironing_spacing.tooltip: The distance between the lines of ironing.

support_line_width.label: Support
support_line_width.tooltip: Line width of support. If expressed as a %, it will be computed over the nozzle diameter.

support_material_interface_fan_speed.label: Support interface fan speed
support_material_interface_fan_speed.tooltip:
This part cooling fan speed is applied when printing support interfaces. Setting this parameter to a higher than regular speed reduces the layer binding strength between supports and the supported part, making them easier to separate.
Set to -1 to disable it.
This setting is overridden by disable_fan_first_layers.

support_multi_bed_types.label: Support multi bed types
support_multi_bed_types.tooltip: Enable this option if you want to use multiple bed types.

support_object_first_layer_gap.label: Support/object first layer gap
support_object_first_layer_gap.tooltip: XY separation between an object and its support at the first layer.

support_object_xy_distance.label: Support/object XY distance
support_object_xy_distance.tooltip: XY separation between an object and its support.

support_on_build_plate_only.label: On build plate only
support_on_build_plate_only.tooltip: Don't create support on model surface, only on build plate.

support_remove_small_overhang.label: Ignore small overhangs
support_remove_small_overhang.tooltip: Ignore small overhangs that possibly don't require support.

support_style.label: Style
support_style.tooltip:
Style and shape of the support. For normal support, projecting the supports into a regular grid will create more stable supports (default), while snug support towers will save material and reduce object scarring.
For tree support, slim and organic style will merge branches more aggressively and save a lot of material (default organic), while hybrid style will create similar structure to normal support under large flat overhangs.

support_threshold_angle.label: Threshold angle
support_threshold_angle.tooltip: Support will be generated for overhangs whose slope angle is below the threshold.

support_threshold_overlap.label: Threshold overlap
support_threshold_overlap.tooltip: If threshold angle is zero, support will be generated for overhangs whose overlap is below the threshold. The smaller this value is, the steeper the overhang that can be printed without support.

support_top_z_distance.label: Top Z distance
support_top_z_distance.tooltip: The Z gap between the top support interface and object.

support_type.label: Type
support_type.tooltip: Normal (auto) and Tree (auto) are used to generate support automatically. If Normal (manual) or Tree (manual) is selected, only support enforcers are generated.

sw_renderer.label: Render with a software renderer
sw_renderer.tooltip: Render with a software renderer. The bundled MESA software renderer is loaded instead of the default OpenGL driver.

symmetric_infill_y_axis.label: Symmetric infill Y axis
symmetric_infill_y_axis.tooltip: If the model has two parts that are symmetric about the Y axis, and you want these parts to have symmetric textures, please click this option on one of the parts.

temperature_vitrification.label: Softening temperature
temperature_vitrification.tooltip: The material softens at this temperature, so when the bed temperature is equal to or greater than this, it's highly recommended to open the front door and/or remove the upper glass to avoid clogging.

template_custom_gcode.label: Custom G-code
template_custom_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a custom code.

textured_cool_plate_temp.label: Other layers
textured_cool_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Textured Cool Plate.

textured_cool_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
textured_cool_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Textured Cool Plate.

textured_plate_temp.label: Other layers
textured_plate_temp.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers except the initial one. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Textured PEI Plate.

textured_plate_temp_initial_layer.label: Initial layer
textured_plate_temp_initial_layer.tooltip: Bed temperature of the initial layer. A value of 0 means the filament does not support printing on the Textured PEI Plate.

thick_bridges.label: Thick external bridges
thick_bridges.tooltip: If enabled, bridges are more reliable, can bridge longer distances, but may look worse. If disabled, bridges look better but are reliable just for shorter bridged distances.

thick_internal_bridges.label: Thick internal bridges
thick_internal_bridges.tooltip: If enabled, thick internal bridges will be used. It's usually recommended to have this feature turned on. However, consider turning it off if you are using large nozzles.

thumbnails.label: G-code thumbnails
thumbnails.tooltip: Picture sizes to be stored into a .gcode and .sl1 / .sl1s files, in the following format: "XxY, XxY, ..."

thumbnails_format.label: Format of G-code thumbnails
thumbnails_format.tooltip: Format of G-code thumbnails: PNG for best quality, JPG for smallest size, QOI for low memory firmware.

timelapse_type.label: Timelapse
timelapse_type.tooltip: If smooth or traditional mode is selected, a timelapse video will be generated for each print. After each layer is printed, a snapshot is taken with the chamber camera. All of these snapshots are composed into a timelapse video when printing completes. If smooth mode is selected, the toolhead will move to the excess chute after each layer is printed and then take a snapshot. Since the melt filament may leak from the nozzle during the process of taking a snapshot, prime tower is required for smooth mode to wipe nozzle.

timestamp.label: Timestamp
timestamp.tooltip: String containing current time in yyyyMMdd-hhmmss format.

top_bottom_infill_wall_overlap.label: Top/Bottom solid infill/wall overlap
top_bottom_infill_wall_overlap.tooltip: Top solid infill area is enlarged slightly to overlap with wall for better bonding and to minimize the appearance of pinholes where the top infill meets the walls. A value of 25-30% is a good starting point, minimizing the appearance of pinholes. The percentage value is relative to line width of sparse infill.

top_shell_layers.label: Top shell layers
top_shell_layers.tooltip: This is the number of solid layers of top shell, including the top surface layer. When the thickness calculated by this value is thinner than top shell thickness, the top shell layers will be increased.

top_shell_thickness.label: Top shell thickness
top_shell_thickness.tooltip: The number of top solid layers is increased when slicing if the thickness calculated by top shell layers is thinner than this value. This can avoid having too thin shell when layer height is small. 0 means that this setting is disabled and thickness of top shell is absolutely determined by top shell layers.

top_solid_infill_flow_ratio.label: Top surface flow ratio
top_solid_infill_flow_ratio.tooltip:
This factor affects the amount of material for top solid infill. You can decrease it slightly to have smooth surface finish.

The actual top surface flow used is calculated by multiplying this value with the filament flow ratio, and if set, the object's flow ratio.

top_surface_acceleration.label: Top surface
top_surface_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration of top surface infill. Using a lower value may improve top surface quality.

top_surface_density.label: Top surface density
top_surface_density.tooltip: Density of top surface layer. A value of 100% creates a fully solid, smooth top layer. Reducing this value results in a textured top surface, according to the chosen top surface pattern. A value of 0% will result in only the walls on the top layer being created. Intended for aesthetic or functional purposes, not to fix issues such as over-extrusion.

top_surface_line_width.label: Top surface
top_surface_line_width.tooltip: Line width for top surfaces. If expressed as a %, it will be computed over the nozzle diameter.

top_surface_pattern.label: Top surface pattern
top_surface_pattern.tooltip: Line pattern of top surface infill.

top_surface_speed.label: Top surface
top_surface_speed.tooltip: Speed of top surface infill which is solid.

total_cost.label: Total cost
total_cost.tooltip: Total cost of all material used in the print. Calculated from filament_cost value in Filament Settings.

total_layer_count.label: Total layer count
total_layer_count.tooltip: Number of layers in the entire print.

total_toolchanges.label: Total tool changes
total_toolchanges.tooltip: Number of tool changes during the print.

total_weight.label: Total weight
total_weight.tooltip: Total weight of the print. Calculated from filament_density value in Filament Settings.

total_wipe_tower_cost.label: Total wipe tower cost
total_wipe_tower_cost.tooltip: Total cost of the material wasted on the wipe tower. Calculated from filament_cost value in Filament Settings.

total_wipe_tower_filament.label: Wipe tower volume
total_wipe_tower_filament.tooltip: Total filament volume extruded on the wipe tower.

travel_slope.label: Traveling angle
travel_slope.tooltip: Traveling angle for Slope and Spiral Z-hop type. Setting it to 90° results in Normal Lift.

travel_speed.label: Travel
travel_speed.tooltip: Speed of travel which is faster and without extrusion.

travel_speed_z.label: Z travel
travel_speed_z.tooltip: Speed of vertical travel along z axis. This is typically lower because build plate or gantry is hard to be moved. Zero means using travel speed directly in G-code, but will be limited by printer's ability when run G-code.

tree_support_angle_slow.label: Preferred Branch Angle
tree_support_angle_slow.tooltip: The preferred angle of the branches, when they do not have to avoid the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle for branches to merge faster.

tree_support_auto_brim.label: Auto brim width
tree_support_auto_brim.tooltip: Enabling this option means the width of the brim for tree support will be automatically calculated.

tree_support_branch_angle.label: Tree support branch angle
tree_support_branch_angle.tooltip: This setting determines the maximum overhang angle that the branches of tree support are allowed to make. If the angle is increased, the branches can be printed more horizontally, allowing them to reach farther.

tree_support_branch_angle_organic.label: Tree support branch angle
tree_support_branch_angle_organic.tooltip: This setting determines the maximum overhang angle that the branches of tree support are allowed to make. If the angle is increased, the branches can be printed more horizontally, allowing them to reach farther.

tree_support_branch_diameter.label: Tree support branch diameter
tree_support_branch_diameter.tooltip: This setting determines the initial diameter of support nodes.

tree_support_branch_diameter_angle.label: Branch Diameter Angle
tree_support_branch_diameter_angle.tooltip: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the organic support.

tree_support_branch_diameter_organic.label: Tree support branch diameter
tree_support_branch_diameter_organic.tooltip: This setting determines the initial diameter of support nodes.

tree_support_branch_distance.label: Tree support branch distance
tree_support_branch_distance.tooltip: This setting determines the distance between neighboring tree support nodes.

tree_support_branch_distance_organic.label: Tree support branch distance
tree_support_branch_distance_organic.tooltip: This setting determines the distance between neighboring tree support nodes.

tree_support_brim_width.label: Tree support brim width
tree_support_brim_width.tooltip: Distance from tree branch to the outermost brim line.

tree_support_tip_diameter.label: Tip Diameter
tree_support_tip_diameter.tooltip: Branch tip diameter for organic supports.

tree_support_top_rate.label: Branch Density
tree_support_top_rate.tooltip: Adjusts the density of the support structure used to generate the tips of the branches. A higher value results in better overhangs but the supports are harder to remove, thus it is recommended to enable top support interfaces instead of a high branch density value if dense interfaces are needed.

tree_support_wall_count.label: Support wall loops
tree_support_wall_count.tooltip: This setting specifies the count of support walls in the range of [0,2]. 0 means auto.

tree_support_with_infill.label: Tree support with infill
tree_support_with_infill.tooltip: This setting specifies whether to add infill inside large hollows of tree support.

uptodate.label: UpToDate
uptodate.tooltip: Update the config values of 3MF to latest.

uptodate_filaments.label: Load uptodate filament settings when using uptodate
uptodate_filaments.tooltip: Load uptodate filament settings from the specified file when using uptodate.

uptodate_settings.label: Load uptodate process/machine settings when using uptodate
uptodate_settings.tooltip: Load uptodate process/machine settings from the specified file when using uptodate.

use_firmware_retraction.label: Use firmware retraction
use_firmware_retraction.tooltip: This experimental setting uses G10 and G11 commands to have the firmware handle the retraction. This is only supported in recent Marlin.

use_relative_e_distances.label: Use relative E distances
use_relative_e_distances.tooltip: Relative extrusion is recommended when using "label_objects" option. Some extruders work better with this option unchecked (absolute extrusion mode). Wipe tower is only compatible with relative mode. It is recommended on most printers. Default is checked.

used_filament.label: Used filament
used_filament.tooltip: Total length of filament used in the print.

used_filament_length.label: Filament length (meters)
used_filament_length.tooltip: Total filament length used in meters. Replaced with actual value during post-processing.

wall_direction.label: Wall loop direction
wall_direction.tooltip:
The direction which the wall loops are extruded when looking down from the top.

By default all walls are extruded in counter-clockwise, unless Reverse on even is enabled. Set this to any option other than Auto will force the wall direction regardless of the Reverse on even.

This option will be disabled if spiral vase mode is enabled.

wall_distribution_count.label: Wall distribution count
wall_distribution_count.tooltip: The number of walls, counted from the center, over which the variation needs to be spread. Lower values mean that the outer walls don't change in width.

wall_generator.label: Wall generator
wall_generator.tooltip: Classic wall generator produces walls with constant extrusion width and for very thin areas is used gap-fill. Arachne engine produces walls with variable extrusion width.

wall_loops.label: Wall loops
wall_loops.tooltip: Number of walls of every layer.

wall_sequence.label: Walls printing order
wall_sequence.tooltip:
Print sequence of the internal (inner) and external (outer) walls.

Use Inner/Outer for best overhangs. This is because the overhanging walls can adhere to a neighbouring perimeter while printing. However, this option results in slightly reduced surface quality as the external perimeter is deformed by being squashed to the internal perimeter.

Use Inner/Outer/Inner for the best external surface finish and dimensional accuracy as the external wall is printed undisturbed from an internal perimeter. However, overhang performance will reduce as there is no internal perimeter to print the external wall against. This option requires a minimum of 3 walls to be effective as it prints the internal walls from the 3rd perimeter onwards first, then the external perimeter and, finally, the first internal perimeter. This option is recommended against the Outer/Inner option in most cases.

Use Outer/Inner for the same external wall quality and dimensional accuracy benefits of Inner/Outer/Inner option. However, the Z seams will appear less consistent as the first extrusion of a new layer starts on a visible surface.

wall_transition_angle.label: Wall transitioning threshold angle
wall_transition_angle.tooltip: When to create transitions between even and odd numbers of walls. A wedge shape with an angle greater than this setting will not have transitions and no walls will be printed in the center to fill the remaining space. Reducing this setting reduces the number and length of these center walls, but may leave gaps or overextrude.

wall_transition_filter_deviation.label: Wall transitioning filter margin
wall_transition_filter_deviation.tooltip: Prevent transitioning back and forth between one extra wall and one less. This margin extends the range of extrusion widths which follow to [Minimum wall width - margin, 2 * Minimum wall width + margin]. Increasing this margin reduces the number of transitions, which reduces the number of extrusion starts/stops and travel time. However, large extrusion width variation can lead to under- or overextrusion problems. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter.

wall_transition_length.label: Wall transition length
wall_transition_length.tooltip: When transitioning between different numbers of walls as the part becomes thinner, a certain amount of space is allotted to split or join the wall segments. It's expressed as a percentage over nozzle diameter.

wipe.label: Wipe while retracting
wipe.tooltip: Move nozzle along the last extrusion path when retracting to clean any leaked material on the nozzle. This can minimize blobs when printing a new part after traveling.

wipe_before_external_loop.label: Wipe before external loop
wipe_before_external_loop.tooltip:
To minimize visibility of potential overextrusion at the start of an external perimeter when printing with Outer/Inner or Inner/Outer/Inner wall print order, the de-retraction is performed slightly on the inside from the start of the external perimeter. That way any potential over extrusion is hidden from the outside surface.

This is useful when printing with Outer/Inner or Inner/Outer/Inner wall print order as in these modes it is more likely an external perimeter is printed immediately after a de-retraction move.

wipe_distance.label: Wipe Distance
wipe_distance.tooltip:
Describe how long the nozzle will move along the last path when retracting.

Depending on how long the wipe operation lasts, how fast and long the extruder/filament retraction settings are, a retraction move may be needed to retract the remaining filament.

Setting a value in the retract amount before wipe setting below will perform any excess retraction before the wipe, else it will be performed after.

wipe_on_loops.label: Wipe on loops
wipe_on_loops.tooltip: To minimize the visibility of the seam in a closed loop extrusion, a small inward movement is executed before the extruder leaves the loop.

wipe_speed.label: Wipe speed
wipe_speed.tooltip: The wipe speed is determined by the speed setting specified in this configuration. If the value is expressed as a percentage (e.g. 80%), it will be calculated based on the travel speed setting above. The default value for this parameter is 80%.

wipe_tower_bridging.label: Maximal bridging distance
wipe_tower_bridging.tooltip: Maximal distance between supports on sparse infill sections.

wipe_tower_cone_angle.label: Stabilization cone apex angle
wipe_tower_cone_angle.tooltip: Angle at the apex of the cone that is used to stabilize the wipe tower. Larger angle means wider base.

wipe_tower_extra_flow.label: Extra flow for purging
wipe_tower_extra_flow.tooltip: Extra flow used for the purging lines on the wipe tower. This makes the purging lines thicker or narrower than they normally would be. The spacing is adjusted automatically.

wipe_tower_extra_rib_length.label: Extra rib length
wipe_tower_extra_rib_length.tooltip: Positive values can increase the size of the rib wall, while negative values can reduce the size. However, the size of the rib wall can not be smaller than that determined by the cleaning volume.

wipe_tower_extra_spacing.label: Wipe tower purge lines spacing
wipe_tower_extra_spacing.tooltip: Spacing of purge lines on the wipe tower.

wipe_tower_filament.label: Wipe tower
wipe_tower_filament.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing perimeter of the wipe tower. Set to 0 to use the one that is available (non-soluble would be preferred).

wipe_tower_fillet_wall.label: Fillet wall
wipe_tower_fillet_wall.tooltip: The wall of prime tower will fillet.

wipe_tower_max_purge_speed.label: Maximum wipe tower print speed
wipe_tower_max_purge_speed.tooltip:
The maximum print speed when purging in the wipe tower and printing the wipe tower sparse layers. When purging, if the sparse infill speed or calculated speed from the filament max volumetric speed is lower, the lowest will be used instead.

When printing the sparse layers, if the internal perimeter speed or calculated speed from the filament max volumetric speed is lower, the lowest will be used instead.

Increasing this speed may affect the tower's stability as well as increase the force with which the nozzle collides with any blobs that may have formed on the wipe tower.

Before increasing this parameter beyond the default of 90 mm/s, make sure your printer can reliably bridge at the increased speeds and that ooze when tool changing is well controlled.

For the wipe tower external perimeters the internal perimeter speed is used regardless of this setting.

wipe_tower_no_sparse_layers.label: No sparse layers (beta)
wipe_tower_no_sparse_layers.tooltip: If enabled, the wipe tower will not be printed on layers with no tool changes. On layers with a tool change, extruder will travel downward to print the wipe tower. User is responsible for ensuring there is no collision with the print.

wipe_tower_rib_width.label: Rib width
wipe_tower_rib_width.tooltip: Rib width is always less than half the prime tower side length.

wipe_tower_rotation_angle.label: Wipe tower rotation angle
wipe_tower_rotation_angle.tooltip: Wipe tower rotation angle with respect to X axis.

wipe_tower_wall_type.label: Wall type
wipe_tower_wall_type.tooltip:
Wipe tower outer wall type.
1. Rectangle: The default wall type, a rectangle with fixed width and height.
2. Cone: A cone with a fillet at the bottom to help stabilize the wipe tower.
3. Rib: Adds four ribs to the tower wall for enhanced stability.

wipe_tower_x.label: Position X
wipe_tower_x.tooltip: X coordinate of the left front corner of a wipe tower.

wipe_tower_y.label: Position Y
wipe_tower_y.tooltip: Y coordinate of the left front corner of a wipe tower.

wiping_volumes_extruders.label: Purging volumes - load/unload volumes
wiping_volumes_extruders.tooltip: This vector saves required volumes to change from/to each tool used on the wipe tower. These values are used to simplify creation of the full purging volumes below.

xy_contour_compensation.label: X-Y contour compensation
xy_contour_compensation.tooltip: Contours of objects will expand or contract in the XY plane by the configured value. Positive values make contours bigger, negative values make contours smaller. This function is used to adjust sizes slightly when the objects have assembling issues.

xy_hole_compensation.label: X-Y hole compensation
xy_hole_compensation.tooltip: Holes in objects will expand or contract in the XY plane by the configured value. Positive values make holes bigger, negative values make holes smaller. This function is used to adjust sizes slightly when the objects have assembling issues.

z_hop.label: Z-hop height
z_hop.tooltip: Whenever the retraction is done, the nozzle is lifted a little to create clearance between nozzle and the print. It prevents nozzle from hitting the print when travel move. Using spiral lines to lift Z can prevent stringing.

z_offset.label: Z offset
z_offset.tooltip: This value will be added (or subtracted) from all the Z coordinates in the output G-code. It is used to compensate for bad Z endstop position: for example, if your endstop zero actually leaves the nozzle 0.3mm far from the print bed, set this to -0.3 (or fix your endstop).

zhop.label: Current Z-hop
zhop.tooltip: Contains Z-hop present at the beginning of the custom G-code block.
